summaryOfNewsArticle: On November 15, 2023, the government announced a comprehensive new environmental policy aimed at reducing carbon emissions and promoting renewable energy. The policy, supported by Prime Minister [Name], will be implemented starting in December 2023 and is expected to be fully operational by March 31, 2024. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) will be responsible for enforcing the regulations and reporting on progress. This move reflects a growing political emphasis on climate change and sustainability, responding to both domestic concerns and international pressure. The policy is expected to have significant implications for industries, energy sectors, and public health, with ongoing monitoring to assess its impact.
